intro: Glossoloma subglabrum, commonly known as the smooth glossoloma, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
